facts.content: If the server takes too long to judge a tourist solution, the server receives a TLE verdict.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist can speak in C++.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Once, tourist sent all his solutions at once and took the first place immediately. 30 seconds later, his solutions were judged.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist solved a NP-Complete problem once. In constant time.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: For tourist, dark mode or light mode doesn't matter, as he usually codes with his eyes closed.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist once solved an n ≤ 10^5 problem using only boolean data types.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist receives "Accepted" verdicts in heuristic competitions.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: When tourist hosts a contest, there aren't any queue delays, because he judges all submissions himself by looking at the source code.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist once enumerated all prime numbers. Backwards.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist's randomized solutions don't have a probability of fail.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: When tourist creates an interactive problem, he doesn't write a interactor program. He interacts with the contestants code himself.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist runs C++ code on interactive shells.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: There aren't prime numbers. Just numbers that tourist hasn't bothered to factor yet.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: When tourist hashes strings, there isn't a risk of collision.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: When tourist wants to make juice, he takes the fruits of segment trees.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: "Segment trees" were actually called "Whole trees" before tourist smashed them.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: The baby and the giant on the baby-step giant-step algorithm are actually running from tourist.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist can overflow bigint data types.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist solved a problem using brainfuck once — In a Kotlin Heroes contest.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist doesn't use sort. He just shakes the array with his own hands until all elements get in the right place.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist always climb up positions in the scoreboard, even if he is already the first — and the scoreboard is frozen.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: When tourist codes a persistent data structure, it LITERALLY can go back on time.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Boolean data types can take more than 2 different values if tourist wants them to.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: All algorithms can be done in at most O(N). If they aren't yet, it's just because tourist didn't bother to optimize them.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist choose his nick because he used to travel to a LOT of cities. And he was always able to choose the optimal path between them.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist doesn't think that naming variables are hard.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist compile code by shrinking it with his bare hands.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist doesn't use doubles. He uses triples, a float-type with no loss of precision.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist can make floats sink by looking at them.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: When born, instead of crying, tourist spelled source code in Delphi. The doctor's response was "Accepted"
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist can count to 2^64. On his fingers.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist has binary trees, fenwick trees and link cut trees growing on his garden.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist doesn't need a stop condition on his recursive algorithms. They stop when he wants them to.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist's phone number, when converted to binary, is actually a compiled C++ code of an FFT implementation.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist can do both range queries and range updates in O(1)
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist can code a segment tree in HTML.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist eats meals in hash tables.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist knows the Lowest Common Ancestor of any pair of people.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist doesn't know the "Heavy-Light Decomposition". He calls it "Light-Lighter Decomposition".
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist knows the Nim value of any chess position.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist can hear programming languages. From computers. Turned off.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Bugs are afraid of tourist.
facts.author: diksown

facts.content: Tourist can sort an array in constant time.
facts.author: Divyanshu-1

facts.content: Tourist can solve N<=1e5 problems in O(N^2).
facts.author: Malhe1ros

facts.content: Tourist doesn't read the statements, he looks at the sample test cases and instantly knows what to do.
facts.author: Malhe1ros

facts.content: Tourist can use MO for online queries.
facts.author: Malhe1ros

facts.content: Tourist coded the program for evolution once, and the rest is history.
facts.author: Mastan1301

facts.content: Tourist can solve two pointers problems with only one pointer.
facts.author: Malhe1ros

facts.content: Tourist's Fourier Transform isn't fast, it's immediate.
facts.author: Malhe1ros

facts.content: Tourist doesn't need to divide to conquer.
facts.author: Malhe1ros

facts.content: When tourist takes educational rounds, the problemsetters learn from him.
facts.author: bucketpotato01

facts.content: Tourist doesn't need to binary search to find the optimal answer. He already knows where it is.
facts.author: Dragonado

facts.content: Tourist can do binary lifting in cyclic graphs.
facts.author: Dragonado

facts.content: Tourist's favourite music is segment tree beats.
facts.author: agrayush13

facts.content: Once tourist wrote a solution so fast it got the verdict: SLE, Speed Limit Exceeded.
facts.author: mshiladityam

facts.content: Tourist can balance a real tree.
facts.author: hydroshiba

facts.content: If tourist doesn't have the highest score in a contest, don't let yourself be fooled. His unsigned int score has just overflowed.
facts.author: AlexandruHurjui12

facts.content: Tourist doesn't even need a keyboard to write code. The code writes itself, under the force of tourist's mind.
facts.author: AlexandruHurjui12

facts.content: Authors panic about the correctness of their model solutions when tourist gets WA.
facts.author: bitstack343

facts.content: When tourist submits an incorrect solution, the problemsetters get WA.
facts.author: Lol-Key

facts.content: For tourist, NP-Hard stands for No Problem is Hard.
facts.author: 007vedant

facts.content: Tourist codes so fast, his typing speed gets integer overflow.
facts.author: 007vedant

facts.content: Tourist never watched fast and furious. He watched fast and fourier instead.
facts.author: EnDeRGeaT

facts.content: Tourist can do binary search without sorting an array.
facts.author: EnDeRGeaT

facts.content: If Tourist loses something, he finds it in logarithmic time.
facts.author: EnDeRGeaT

facts.content: A famous website had its name in the singular until tourist submitted a divide and conquer code on it. It is now called Codeforces.
facts.author: viniciuscabessa

facts.content: Tourist never needs a plumber. He just runs the max-flow algorithm on it.
facts.author: Spheniscine

facts.content: Tourist can code a deterministic quicksort with no quadratic cases.
facts.author: Spheniscine

facts.content: Tourist used FFT to multiply numbers in grade school.
facts.author: Spheniscine

facts.content: Tourist never gets the Memory Limit Exceeded verdict, as his submissions use his own brain for storage space.
facts.author: Spheniscine

facts.content: Tourist can divide by zero.
facts.author: Spheniscine

facts.content: Tourist always computes the full answer for combinatorial problems before reducing it by modulo.
facts.author: Spheniscine

facts.content: Organizers send first prize to tourist even before conducting the contest.
facts.author: priyanshu003

facts.content: tourist can write one solution that can get an AC on every algorithmic problem existed.
facts.author: priyanshu003

facts.content: Tourist solves interactive problems. Offline.
facts.author: SecondThread

facts.content: The only thing tourist doesn't know is what it feels like to press the backspace key.
facts.author: SecondThread

facts.content: When tourist is bored, he occasionally solves the problems from hardest to easiest. And once he's done that, sometimes he reads the problem statements too.
facts.author: SecondThread

facts.content: Tourist is rainboy's alt.
facts.author: SecondThread

facts.content: Tourist's code doesn't even need a first thread to run in time; it simply compiles itself into the correct output using preprocessor commands.
facts.author: SecondThread

facts.content: They used to call him the traveling salesman. Now they just call him 'tourist'.
facts.author: SecondThread

facts.content: Tourist doesn't check his code on the sample cases, he checks the sample cases on his code.
facts.author: GabrielDWu

facts.content: The time limit to a problem isn't the amount of time it takes Tourist's solution to run, its the time it takes for him to finish coding.
facts.author: GabrielDWu

facts.content: g++ -O4 sends your code to tourist for rewrite.
facts.author: jonathanirvings

facts.content: When tourist was a contestant at IOI he didn't have an "I want more food" sign, but an "I want more problems" sign.
facts.author: LaviniaTornaghi

facts.content: Tourist solves problems in O(1/n).
facts.author: YuldShah

facts.content: Tourist doesn't need version control. Git commits to him.
facts.author: YuldShah

facts.content: Upon hitting 4000 rating, Tourist proved that P = NP, but kept it secret because it would make the contests too easy for everyone else.
facts.author: YuldShah

facts.content: Tourist was once so bored that he decided to optimize the Santa's gift delivery algorithm to visit multiple parallel universes at a time.
facts.author: YuldShah

facts.content: Codeforces didn't give Tourist 4000 rating, Tourist gave Codeforces the honor of displaying his true power level.
facts.author: YuldShah

facts.content: Tourist's "Hello World" program solved NP-complete problems.
facts.author: YuldShah
